technical_stack.icons: Lucide React (for UI controls), Inline SVGs (for doodles)

rules: Use 'Caveat' for all user-generated notes and main headings.
Use 'Patrick Hand' for shorter labels or buttons.
Use 'Nunito' ONLY for small UI elements/tooltips where legibility is critical.
CRITICAL: NEVER use Inter, Roboto, or System Sans.

colors.gradients: FORBIDDEN. Do not use gradients. Use solid colors or textures.

doodles.tape_svg: Polygon shapes with jagged edges to simulate torn tape

Board.description: Infinite or large fixed canvas. Background must be 'board_bg' with the 'paper_overlay' blended (multiply/opacity).
Board.behavior: Drop zone for notes. Click empty space to focus.
Board.styles: min-h-screen w-full relative overflow-hidden cursor-crosshair bg-[#FDFBF7]

interactions: Drag: Follows cursor, scales up slightly (1.05), shadow deepens.
Throw: On release, calculate velocity. Animate 'x/y' to new position based on velocity vector.
Z-Index: Bring to front on drag start.
StickyNote.visuals: Random rotation (-5deg to 5deg). Hand-drawn border radius (approx 2px-255px random? No, just 'rounded-sm' but maybe CSS clip-path for rough edges if possible, otherwise standard rounded-md is acceptable if rotated).
StickyNote.content: Text flows naturally. Font size adjusts based on text length (clamp).

Composer.description: Floating panel or bottom bar to create new notes.
Composer.visuals: Looks like a torn piece of paper or a sketchbook page. NOT a modal dialog.

states.listening: Pulsing red/orange animation. Real-time transcript preview.

physics.logic: Use 'useDrag' hook. On 'down: false' (release), read 'velocity' and 'direction'. Calculate landing position: current + (velocity * 200). Update state.

storage.schema: [{ id: string, text: string, x: number, y: number, rotation: number, color: string, zIndex: number, createdAt: number }]

accessibility.reduced_motion: Disable fling physics if prefers-reduced-motion is true.
accessibility.contrast: Ensure text is #2D2D2D on pastel backgrounds (Passes AAA).

universal_guidelines: Do not use generic 'clean' SaaS shadows. Use distinct, directional shadows.
Avoid symmetry. Randomize rotations of notes.
Make it feel 'sticky' - dragging should feel like peeling it off.
Keep UI controls minimal. The content (notes) is the hero.
Add a 'crumpled paper' texture overlay to the entire .App container with mix-blend-mode: multiply and low opacity (10-20%).
